result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad M Richmond

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant Chad M Richmond in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Benjamin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Judge Kremers is hearing this case for Judge Havas, who is in trial.
On state's motion and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered case dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
Jury trial date of 03/21/2016 vacated.

Justice Point Violation Report received and filed: GPS violation.  
Court takes no action and will address the matter on the next court date of 3-01-2016.

Justice Point Violation Report received and filed:  missed office contact, drug test, and GPS violation on 2-15-2016.  Court takes no action and will address the matter on the next court date of 3-01-2016.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.

Justice Point Violation Report received and filed:   2-01-2016:  missed office contact, missed breathalyzer test, GPS violation- failed to respond.  Defendant contacted Justice Point prior to missed contact.  
Court takes no action and will address the matter on the next court date of 03-01-2016.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense counsel to provide proof of additional monitoring.

Defendant Chad M Richmond in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 08:15 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Chad M Richmond in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Paul A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to withdraw heard and granted.  Jury trial date to convert to Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Defendant resides outside the County.  Motion to remove GPS monitoring heard and denied.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Chad M Richmond not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned in branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Chad M Richmond not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The court is advised that there are 2 pending uncharged referrals.  The court orders charged cases joined for trial (15CM3404, 15CM3313, 15CM1535).   Cases set for final pretrial on 11-24-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 1-4-2016 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing. Defendant has new case pending and is in custody.

Defendant Chad M Richmond in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 10-28-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  mld

from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Chad M Richmond in court.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does qualify for public defender representation. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.    
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Christina F; Mackenzie R; Cyara N.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. 
Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.
